intro: Blepharis teaguei, commonly known as the Teague's fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. The plant produces delicate, lantern-shaped seed capsules that are a striking feature of its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
